meanings.sent1: She is so gullibly trusting, always falling for scams.
meanings.sent2: The gullibly young child believed the magician's tricks were real.
meanings.sent3: He gullibly thought the 'free vacation' offer was too good to be true.
meanings.sent4: The gullibly innocent puppy followed the stranger without hesitation.
meanings.sent5: The gullibly naive student believed everything the con artist said.

meanings.definition: In a manner that shows a willingness to believe or trust too readily.
meanings.sent1: She gullibly believed the gossip without questioning it.
meanings.sent2: He gullibly followed the advice without considering other options.
meanings.sent3: The gullibly optimistic girl thought everything would work out perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The politician gullibly promised to fix all the problems overnight.
meanings.sent5: The gullibly eager customer bought the product without reading the reviews.
